definitions.definition: A mixture of fine solid particles or liquid droplets suspended in a gaseous medium.
examples: Examples of common aerosols are mist , fog , and smoke .

definitions.definition: The payload (e.g. insecticide, paint, oil, cosmetics) and propellant contained by an aerosol can.
A colloidal system in which the dispersed phase is composed of either solid or liquid particles and in which the dispersal medium is some gas , usually air .

main_definition: A mixture of fine solid particles or liquid droplets suspended in a gaseous medium.
secondary_definitions: The payload (e.g. insecticide, paint, oil, cosmetics) and propellant contained by an aerosol can.
( physics ) A colloidal system in which the dispersed phase is composed of either solid or liquid particles and in which the dispersal medium is some gas , usually air .
